last_generation_notes:
Scope and method: Generated the December 2025 Microsoft Teams schedule using confirmed entries from the uploaded file for 12/29–12/31 and preserved their sharing status. Time-off entries and unavailability ranges were treated as hard constraints when assigning these shifts. Color codes strictly follow the Microsoft Teams legend (e.g., 1. Weiß for Operation Lead, 10. Dunkelviolett for Pikett).
Coverage summary for 12/29–12/31: PCV WoVe, SOB Wove, SOB Backup, Dispatcher Wove (07:00–16:00), Dispatcher (09:00–18:00), People Developer / Stellvertretung, multiple Contact Team tiers (07:00–16:00, 08:00–17:00, 09:00–18:00, 10:00–19:00), and Pikett SOB (18:00–00:00) are covered per-day; overnight Pikett shifts have end_date on the next calendar day.
Known gaps and rule notes: (1) Operation Lead was not scheduled on 12/29–12/31 (role gap). (2) Late-shift rotation: Majic, Marko-MGB is assigned 10:00–19:00 on three consecutive days (12/29–12/31), which may violate late-rotation fairness; retained to match provided plan. (3) 12/30 has Techbar (Tue) and IT Redakteur potential templates, but no coverage was provided in the source data; these remain unassigned. (4) Pikett 24h is not assigned for 12/29–12/31; only evening Pikett SOB coverage was present in source data. (5) Double-load consideration: On 12/29 and 12/30, Grusovin, Nico-MGB holds a day assignment (People Developer) and evening Pikett SOB; this long day + on-call combination is accepted from the source schedule but flagged for fatigue risk. (6) Unavailability conflicts were checked against December time-off: no direct conflict with the published shift assignments (e.g., Schweizer, Doris-MGB is on Kompensation 12/30 only and not scheduled that day; she is scheduled 12/29 and 12/31). (7) Significant time-off blocks (e.g., Pivetta, Tino-MGB 12/22–01/17; Veiga, Bryan-MGB 12/22–01/03; Fanger, Carmen-MGB 12/22–01/05; etc.) were respected—none of these employees are scheduled within their leave windows here.
Fairness/rotation: Within the limited 3-day published window, distribution broadly reflects the source rotation. For the full month (12/01–12/28), the uploaded file contained time-offs but no confirmed daily shifts; those days are not published here and should be planned separately to achieve month-long fairness.
Import notes: All entries include appropriate color_code strings (e.g., 3. Grün for SOB roles; 6. Gelb for Dispatcher 09:00–18:00). Overnight Pikett shifts span to the next day for end_date=00:00 to preserve chronology in Teams. Shared status mirrors the source (1. Geteilt vs 2. Nicht freigegeben). If additional roles must be covered earlier in the month, please provide confirmed headcounts; otherwise these remain open and are documented above.
